letras: In Scarlet Town, where I was born/n
There's ivy leaf and silver thorn/n
The streets have names that you can't pronounce/n
Gold is down to a q
uarter of an ounce/n
The music starts and the people sway/n
Everybody says, "Are you going my way? "/n
Uncle Tom still workin' for Uncle Bill/n
Scarlet Town is u
nder the hill./n
Scarlet Town in the month of May/n
Sweet William Holme on his deathbed lay/n
Mistress Mary by the side of the bed/n
Kissin' his face and heapin' p
rayers on his head/n
So brave, so true, so gentle is he/n
I'll weep for him as he would weep for me/n
Little Boy Blue come your blow horn/n
In Scarlet Town, wher
e I was born/n
Scarlet Town, in the hot noon hours,/n
There's palm-leaf shadows and scattered flowers/n
Beggars crouching at the gate/n
Help comes, but it co
mes too late/n
By marble slabs and in fields of stone/n
You make your humble wishes known/n
I touched the garment, but the hem was torn/n
In Scarlet Town, whe
re I was born/n
In Scarlet Town, the end is near/n
The Seven Wonders of the World are here/n
The evil and the good livin' side by side/n
All human forms se
em glorified/n
Put your heart on a platter and see who will bite/n
See who will hold you and kiss you good night/n
There's walnut groves and maplewood/n
In Scarlet Town cryin' w
on't do no good/n
In Scarlet Town, you fight your father's foes/n
Up on the hill, a chilly wind blows/n
You fight 'em on high and you fight 'em down in/n
You fight 'em with whiskey, m
orphine and gin/n
You've got legs that can drive men mad/n
A lot of things we didn't do that I wish we had/n
In Scarlet Town, the sky is clear/n
You'll wish to God that you st
ayed right here/n
Set 'em Joe, play "Walkin' the Floor"/n
Play it for my flat-chested junkie whore/n
I'm staying up late, I'm making amends/n
While we smile, all h
eaven descends/n
If love is a sin, then beauty is a crime/n
All things are beautiful in their time/n
The black and the white, the yellow and the brown/n
It's all right there in front of you in
Scarlet Town
